data.title: Mrs. Ellen Lew Bride of Dr. Harlan Spitz
data.text:
Mrs. Ellen Handler Lew of Briarcliff Manor, N.Y., and Dr. Harlan Spitz, a pediatrician, were married last evening at the St. Moritz. Rabbi Israel Mowshowitz performed the ceremony, assisted by Cantor Avraham Albrecht.

The bride, head of the art department of the Halstead School in Yonkers, is the daughter of Leslie Handler of New York, a partner in the law firm of Friedman, Marx & Handler, and the late Mrs. Beulah Hoffberg Handler. A graduate of Barnard College, she has a master's degree in teaching from Harvard University. Her former marriage ended in divorce.

Dr. Spitz is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Spitz of Jamaica Estates, Queens. Mr. Spitz is general counsel to the State Division of Human Rights. Mrs. Spitz is on the faculty of the Brooklyn College School of Education.

The bridegroom, who has degrees from Princeton University and the Yale Medical School, will join the child psychiatry faculty of the Albert Einstein College of Medicine of Yeshiva University, July 1. He is a former captain in the Air Force Medical Corps.
